intro: Terminalis mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius terminalis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Mauritius. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are pale green to white in color. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Terminalis mauritiana is considered a vulnerable species.
